article.headline: Saint Louis 75, MVSU 39
article.story: ST. LOUIS -- Willie Reed led all scorers with 17 points and Saint Louis beat Mississippi Valley State 75-39 in the Chicago Invitational Challenge on Tuesday night. Reed shot 8 of 9 from the field to help the Billikens improve to 4-0 for the first time since the 1997-98 season. Jason Holmes led Mississippi Valley State (1-4) with 13 points. Christian Salecich finished with 14 points, Justin Jordan had 12 and Kyle Cassity added 10 for Saint Louis. The Delta Devils kept the game close early in the second half and pulled to within 40-31 when D'Angelo Jackson scored off a drive with 15:16 left. But the Billikens then delivered a knockout blow in the form a 35-5 run. Saint Louis hit seven 3-pointers, including two each from Salecich, Jordan and Femi John, during that stretch.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
